ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned the basics of lab science as it relates to archaeology and how to use several different scientific analysis machines.

I learned a lot about archaeological lab technique. I also got to conduct some research with a partner, which taught me about collecting and analyzing data. This was a great class to introduce me to some general themes in archaeology while also giving me some hands-on experience.
I developed essential technical skills that I believe will help me in my intended career. I also learned how to work with museum officials and conduct research collaboratively.

I learned about many different experimental processes and many different instruments that are used to make observations about archeological samples. Learned about IR spectroscopy, archaeomagnetism and other processes.
Use of qualitative and quantitive techniques in archaeological sciences, use of portable x ray florescence and other compositional equipment.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was very well-organized. We spent the beginning weeks of the class learning about 4 different lab methods, and for the last few weeks we did a research project which involved applying those methods. It was a very intuitive process, and I felt like everything we learned built off of the previous topics.
I wouldnt change anything about this course. The mix of lecture and application was perfect and the final project was an amazing opportunity.
I think we could have done more labs or more practice with the actual equipment since we really only had one day for each thing, and did not get to use them ourselves for the most part.
Greater in class demonstration of statistical techniques.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would, but only for students who want to pursue archaeology. This was a great class for learning about archaeology, but it would not be useful to anyone else.
If a student is interested in pursuing archaeology, I would absolutely recommend this course.

I would probably only recommend this course if you are interested in Archaeology since otherwise it would probably not be very exciting, however the material is very engaging and you learn a lot about different materials and things so it was very interesting.
Yes, the class demonstrated crucial techniques in archaeological sciences and it should be a requirement for anyone in the discipline.
